summary.intent: Add a new section 10.4 (LLM-Generated Verbal Bloat) to the completeness evaluator prompt to detect phrase-level bloat patterns in AGENTS.md files generated by LLMs.
summary.outcome: Successfully added section 10.4 to completeness.md with five detection patterns (A-E), updated the task reference from 10.1-10.2 to 10.1-10.4, added evaluator 10 documentation to CLAUDE.md, and committed both files. All 1318 tests passed and lint was clean.

repo: Evaluator section numbering (e.g. 10.4) exists only in LLM JSON output, not in TypeScript routing/filtering logic — no code changes needed for new sub-sections
evaluator-types.ts already has completeness.md configured as 'error' type, so new sections inherit that config automatically
The project uses bun as the package manager/test runner (bun run test, bun run lint)
1318 tests exist in the test suite
CLAUDE.md serves as evaluator coverage documentation that must be kept in sync when new evaluator sections are added
Section 10.4 belongs in the content balance axis alongside 10.1 (too short), 10.2 (too verbose/tutorial), 10.3 (wrong placement)

code.finding: New section 10.4 was inserted before the 'Content Quality Indicators' section at approximately line 192
Task reference updated from '(patterns 10.1-10.2 above)' to '(patterns 10.1-10.4 above)'

workflow: When adding evaluator sub-sections, the workflow is: edit prompt markdown → update CLAUDE.md docs → run tests → run lint → commit only the relevant files
Selective staging (not git add -A) is important — an unrelated codex-provider.ts change was present and intentionally left unstaged
The /commit skill handles commit message generation and follows the co-authorship convention automatically

friction: Evaluator 10 (completeness) was not previously documented in the CLAUDE.md evaluator coverage section, requiring the assistant to infer what to add based on context
open_items: Unrelated change in codex-provider.ts was left unstaged and uncommitted — needs to be addressed separately
Manual verification of section 10.4 against a known verbose AGENTS.md file (as specified in the plan) was not performed — only automated tests were run
